<JD_START>
Job Title: Auto Technicians - Rick Hendrick Toyota Sandy Springs

Location: Atlanta, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
6475 Roswell Road, Atlanta, GA 30328

AUTOMOTIVE SERVICE TECHNICIAN

Technical Training Or Commensurate Technical Experience Required

Competitive Pay Plan + Great Benefits!

Walk-in Applicants are Welcome!

Rick Hendrick Toyota Sandy Springs is one of the premier automotive groups in the country and needs to add Service Technicians to their busy Service department. Our pay plan and employee benefits are world class and Toyota is one of the premier products in our industry. We are also located in a very high traffic area with a fantastic client base with top-tier credit and because of the size of our company there is unlimited potential for career advancement. We also care about our clients and have fantastic CSI and social reviews.

Every day we recommit ourselves to the customer experience, and we are empowered to exceed the expectations of our customers. Rick Hendricks tradition of winning is based on the idea of striving to be the best, not the biggest, and is therefore defined by how we treat our employees.

We offer:

Competitive pay plan!Medical, Dental and Vision insurance401(k)Paid vacationCareer advancement opportunities! 


Responsibilities – Service Technician:

Identify necessary vehicle service and performing the repair, service, and/or maintenance work, following dealership and manufacturer’s guidelines. Document services performedEffectively utilize available technologies to enhance customer experienceMaintain CSI at or above Company standardsMaintain an organized, clean and safe work areaParticipate in required trainingRecord all hours worked accurately in company’s time-keeping systemDemonstrate the company’s core valuesFollow safeguards, rules and regulations complying with the company’s , Federal and State policies and procedures. Observe all Federal State and local and company safety rulesOther duties as assigned. 


Qualifications – Service Technician:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with medical conditions to perform the essential functions.

Thorough knowledge of automotive parts and systems. Demonstrable mechanical skills and knowledge. Technical training or commensurate technical experience required Completed manufacturer training to perform warranty repairs/recalls on most vehicles, PDI’s, maintenance, and minor repairsCertified / senior technician with Toyota preferredState inspection/emissions license as required by the StateBasic computer skillsHigh school diploma or GED requiredValid driver’s license requiredPlease upload your resume and complete the online assessmentMust be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship and be a current resident. Must pass pre-employment testing to include background checks, MVR, and drug screening. 


Hendrick is an Equal Opportunity employer.

Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
